timeline.message:
Improve command scrubber in MongoClientTracer (#1587)

* Don't scrub the command field value at all if it's a string
* Use JsonWriter to improve efficiency of the scrubber
* If available, user JsonWriter.Builder.maxLength to limit size of the query string

timeline.bodyText: I got this default from the SqlNormalizer
timeline.author: jyemin

timeline.bodyText: This method was added in the 3.7 release of the driver so accessing it reflectively
timeline.author: jyemin

timeline.bodyText: Question for reviewers: should we append a "..." to the query or just cut it off?  Or do we need to make sure that even when truncated it remains valid JSON?
timeline.author: jyemin

replies.bodyText: it looks like SQL just cuts off at the limit like here, so seems good
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: Question for reviewers: since we already extract the collection name into the Span, is it even necessary to preserve it in the scrubbed command?
timeline.author: jyemin

replies.bodyText: preserving it seems good, e.g. table names are preserved when scrubbing sql queries
replies.author: trask
